s.text: George F. Will argues that for Bradley and McCain to win their party's nominations, independent voters (that is, those not affiliated with a single party) would have to become decisive, which is very unlikely in the primaries.
Historian Doris Kearns Goodwin opines that the 21st century will provide more opportunity to help the poor.

People put me up on a pedestal that I don't belong in my personal life.
